00110 //
00111 // T - type if item in container
00112 // I - type of id of item
00113 // G - type of tag used to create/update items
00114 //
00115 template <class T, class I, class G = CECTag>
00116 class CRemoteContainer : public CECPacketHandlerBase {
00117 protected:
00118     enum {
00119         IDLE,            // no request in the air
00120         STATUS_REQ_SENT, // sent request for item status
00121         FULL_REQ_SENT    // sent request for full info
00122     } m_state;
00123     
00124     CRemoteConnect *m_conn;
00125 
00126     std::list<T *> m_items;
00127     std::map<I, T *> m_items_hash;
00128     
00129     // .size() is O(N) operation in stl
00130     int m_item_count;
00131     
00132     // use incremental tags algorithm
00133     bool m_inc_tags;
00134     
00135     // command that will be used in full request
00136     int m_full_req_cmd, m_full_req_tag;
00137     
00138     virtual void HandlePacket(const CECPacket *packet)
00139     {
00140         switch(this->m_state) {
00141             case IDLE: wxFAIL; // not expecting anything
00142             case STATUS_REQ_SENT:
00143                 // if derived class choose not to proceed, return - but with good status
00144                 this->m_state = IDLE;
00145                 if ( this->Phase1Done(packet) ) {
00146                     if (this->m_inc_tags) {
00147                         // Incremental tags: new items always carry full info.
00148                         ProcessUpdate(packet, NULL, m_full_req_tag);
00149                     } else {
00150                         // Non-incremental tags: we might get partial info on new items.
00151                         // Collect all this items in a tag, and then request full info about them.
00152                         CECPacket req_full(this->m_full_req_cmd);
00153                 
00154                         ProcessUpdate(packet, &req_full, m_full_req_tag);
00155                     
00156                         // Phase 3: request full info about files we don't have yet
00157                         if ( req_full.HasChildTags() ) {
00158                             m_conn->SendRequest(this, &req_full);
00159                             this->m_state = FULL_REQ_SENT;
00160                         }
00161                     }
00162                 }
00163                 break;
00164             case FULL_REQ_SENT:
00165                 ProcessFull(packet);
00166                 m_state = IDLE;
00167                 break;
00168         }
00169     }
00170 public:
00171     CRemoteContainer(CRemoteConnect *conn, bool inc_tags)
00172     {
00173         m_state = IDLE;
00174         
00175         m_conn = conn;
00176         m_item_count = 0;
00177         m_inc_tags = inc_tags;
00178     }
00179     
00180     virtual ~CRemoteContainer()
00181     {
00182     }
00183     
00184     typedef typename std::list<T *>::iterator iterator;
00185     iterator begin() { return m_items.begin(); }
00186     iterator end() { return m_items.end(); }
00187 
00188     uint32 GetCount()
00189     {
00190         return m_item_count;
00191     }
00192     
00193     void AddItem(T *item)
00194     {
00195         m_items.push_back(item);
00196         m_items_hash[GetItemID(item)] = item;
00197         m_item_count++;
00198     }
00199 
00200     T *GetByID(I id)
00201     {
00202         // avoid creating nodes
00203         return m_items_hash.count(id) ? m_items_hash[id] : NULL;
00204     }
00205 
00206     void Flush()
00207     {
00208         m_items.clear();
00209         m_items_hash.clear();
00210         m_item_count = 0;
00211     }
00212             
00213     //
00214     // Flush & reload
00215     //
00216     /*
00217     We usually don't keep outdated code as comments, but this blocking implementation
00218     shows the overall procedure well. It had to be scattered for the event driven implementation.
00219 
00220     bool FullReload(int cmd)
00221     {
00222         CECPacket req(cmd);
00223         CScopedPtr<const CECPacket> reply(this->m_conn->SendRecvPacket(&req));
00224         if ( !reply.get() ) {
00225             return false;
00226         }
00227         for(typename std::list<T *>::iterator j = this->m_items.begin(); j != this->m_items.end(); j++) {
00228             this->DeleteItem(*j);
00229         }
00230         
00231         Flush();
00232         
00233         ProcessFull(reply.get());
00234         
00235         return true;
00236     }
00237     */
00238     void FullReload(int cmd)
00239     {
00240         if ( this->m_state != IDLE ) {
00241             return;
00242         }
00243 
00244         for(typename std::list<T *>::iterator j = this->m_items.begin(); j != this->m_items.end(); j++) {
00245             this->DeleteItem(*j);
00246         }
00247         
00248         Flush();
00249 
00250         CECPacket req(cmd);
00251         this->m_conn->SendRequest(this, &req);
00252         this->m_state = FULL_REQ_SENT;
00253         this->m_full_req_cmd = cmd;
00254     }
00255     
00256     //
00257     // Following are like basicly same code as in webserver. Eventually it must
00258     // be same class
00259     //
00260     void DoRequery(int cmd, int tag)
00261     {
00262         if ( this->m_state != IDLE ) {
00263             return;
00264         }
00265         CECPacket req_sts(cmd, m_inc_tags ? EC_DETAIL_INC_UPDATE : EC_DETAIL_UPDATE);
00266         this->m_conn->SendRequest(this, &req_sts);
00267         this->m_state = STATUS_REQ_SENT;
00268         this->m_full_req_cmd = cmd;
00269         this->m_full_req_tag = tag;
00270     }
00271     /*
00272     We usually don't keep outdated code as comments, but this blocking implementation
00273     shows the overall procedure well. It had to be scattered for the event driven implementation.
00274 
00275     bool DoRequery(int cmd, int tag)
00276     {
00277         CECPacket req_sts(cmd, m_inc_tags ? EC_DETAIL_INC_UPDATE : EC_DETAIL_UPDATE);
00278     
00279         //
00280         // Phase 1: request status
00281         CScopedPtr<const CECPacket> reply(this->m_conn->SendRecvPacket(&req_sts));
00282         if ( !reply.get() ) {
00283             return false;
00284         }
00285         
00286         if ( !this->Phase1Done(reply.get()) ) {
00287             // if derived class choose not to proceed, return - but with good status
00288             return true;
00289         }
00290         //
00291         // Phase 2: update status, mark new files for subsequent query
00292         CECPacket req_full(cmd);
00293     
00294         ProcessUpdate(reply.get(), &req_full, tag);
00295     
00296         reply.reset();
00297     
00298         if ( !m_inc_tags ) {
00299             // Phase 3: request full info about files we don't have yet
00300             if ( req_full.GetTagCount() ) {
00301                 reply.reset(this->m_conn->SendRecvPacket(&req_full));
00302                 if ( !reply.get() ) {
00303                     return false;
00304                 }
00305                 ProcessFull(reply.get());
00306             }
00307         }
00308         return true;
00309     }
00310     */
00311 
00312     void ProcessFull(const CECPacket *reply)
00313     {
00314         for (CECPacket::const_iterator it = reply->begin(); it != reply->end(); it++) {
00315             G *tag = (G *) & *it;
00316             // initialize item data from EC tag
00317             AddItem(CreateItem(tag));
00318         }
00319     }
00320 
00321     void RemoveItem(iterator & it)
00322     {
00323         I item_id = GetItemID(*it);
00324         // reduce count
00325         m_item_count--;
00326         // remove from map
00327         m_items_hash.erase(item_id);
00328         // item may contain data that need to be freed externally, before
00329         // dtor is called and memory freed
00330         DeleteItem(*it);
00331 
00332         m_items.erase(it);
00333     }
00334 
00335     virtual void ProcessUpdate(const CECTag *reply, CECPacket *full_req, int req_type)
00336     {
00337         std::set<I> core_files;
00338         for (CECPacket::const_iterator it = reply->begin(); it != reply->end(); it++) {
00339             G *tag = (G *) & *it;
00340             if ( tag->GetTagName() != req_type ) {
00341                 continue;
00342             }
00343     
00344             core_files.insert(tag->ID());
00345             if ( m_items_hash.count(tag->ID()) ) {
00346                 // Item already known: update it
00347                 T *item = m_items_hash[tag->ID()];
00348                 ProcessItemUpdate(tag, item);
00349             } else {
00350                 // New item
00351                 if (full_req) {
00352                     // Non-incremental mode: we have only partial info
00353                     // so we need to request full info before we can use the item
00354                     full_req->AddTag(CECTag(req_type, tag->ID()));
00355                 } else {
00356                     // Incremental mode: new items always carry full info,
00357                     // so we can add it right away
00358                     AddItem(CreateItem(tag));
00359                 }
00360             }
00361         }
00362         for(iterator it = begin(); it != end();) {
00363             iterator it2 = it++;
00364             if ( core_files.count(GetItemID(*it2)) == 0 ) {
00365                 RemoveItem(it2);
00366             }
00367         }
00368     }
00369 
00370     virtual T *CreateItem(G *)
00371     {
00372         return 0;
00373     }
00374     virtual void DeleteItem(T *)
00375     {
00376     }
00377     virtual I GetItemID(T *)
00378     {
00379         return I();
00380     }
00381     virtual void ProcessItemUpdate(G *, T *)
00382     {
00383     }
00384 
00385     virtual bool Phase1Done(const CECPacket *)
00386     {
00387         return true;
00388     }
00389 };

00399     
00400     CServerConnectRem(CRemoteConnect *);
00401     
00402     bool IsConnected() { return (m_ID != 0) && (m_ID != 0xffffffff); }
00403     bool IsConnecting() { return m_ID == 0xffffffff; }
00404     bool IsLowID() { return m_ID < 16777216; }
00405     uint32 GetClientID() { return m_ID; }
00406     CServer *GetCurrentServer() { return m_CurrServer; }
00407     
00408     //
00409     // Actions
00410     //

00412     void ConnectToAnyServer();
00413     void StopConnectionTry();
00414     void Disconnect();
00415 };

00688     bool IsFirewalled() const;
00689     bool IsConnectedED2K() const;
00690     bool IsConnectedKad() const 
00691     { 
00692         return ((m_ConnState & CONNECTED_KAD_OK) 
00693                 || (m_ConnState & CONNECTED_KAD_FIREWALLED));
00694     }
00695     bool IsFirewalledKad() const { return (m_ConnState & CONNECTED_KAD_FIREWALLED) != 0; }
00696     
00697     bool IsKadRunning() const { return ((m_ConnState & CONNECTED_KAD_OK) 
00698                 || (m_ConnState & CONNECTED_KAD_FIREWALLED)
00699                 || (m_ConnState & CONNECTED_KAD_NOT)); }
00700 
00701     // Check Kad state (UDP)
00702     bool IsFirewalledKadUDP() const     { return theStats::IsFirewalledKadUDP(); }
00703     bool IsKadRunningInLanMode() const  { return theStats::IsKadRunningInLanMode(); }
00704     // Kad stats
00705     uint32 GetKadUsers() const          { return theStats::GetKadUsers(); }
00706     uint32 GetKadFiles() const          { return theStats::GetKadFiles(); }
00707     uint32 GetKadIndexedSources() const { return theStats::GetKadIndexedSources(); }
00708     uint32 GetKadIndexedKeywords() const{ return theStats::GetKadIndexedKeywords(); }
00709     uint32 GetKadIndexedNotes() const   { return theStats::GetKadIndexedNotes(); }
00710     uint32 GetKadIndexedLoad() const    { return theStats::GetKadIndexedLoad(); }
00711     // True IP of machine
00712     uint32 GetKadIPAdress() const       { return theStats::GetKadIPAdress(); }
00713     // Buddy status
00714     uint8   GetBuddyStatus() const      { return theStats::GetBuddyStatus(); }
00715     uint32  GetBuddyIP() const          { return theStats::GetBuddyIP(); }
00716     uint32  GetBuddyPort() const        { return theStats::GetBuddyPort(); }

00719     void StopKad();
